answers.author: Roderick Wood
answers.text:
You need to start with a digital system to effectively manage the system.  There are several good companies, if yo are not aware of them, I could send you a couple of names.  I would consider using a hosted system via the cloud as the start up cost are significantly less.

answers.author: Matthew Hawkesworth
answers.text:
I would suggest that a paper option is not a viable option for long-term success.  I agree that an electronic system is the solution.  We use a web-based system that serves the function of CRM, Work-Orders and Code Enforcement Case Tracking.  It is provided by Government Outreach and is a tremendous asset to us.

author: Steve Chapman
text: We are looking for information on best practices for a municipal work order system. It can be an electronic or paper system. We have suspended use of our current system and are looking to start over from the ground up, so any ideas would be helpful.
title: Work Order System Ideas
